ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.2_0: a certain nun was alone with a man, when she had him rupture an abscess growing on the lower part of her body.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.5_0: The nuns came rushing to and asked her why.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.8_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.13_0: “... How could a nun do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.15_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.16.1_0: ‘If a nun, alone with a man, without getting permission from the Sangha or a group, has an abscess or a wound situated on the lower part of her body ruptured by him, or split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped by him, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.5_0: The lower part of the body:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.6_0: below the navel and above the knees.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.16_0: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.18_0: several nuns is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.20_0: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of raping.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.24_0: just the man and the nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.25_0: If she tells him, “Rupture it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.26_0: When it has been ruptured, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.27_0: If she tells him, “Split it open,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.28_0: When it has been split open, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.29_0: If she tells him, “Wash it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.30_0: When it has been washed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.31_0: If she tells him, “Anoint it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.32_0: When it has been anointed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.33_0: If she tells him, “Bandage it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.34_0: When it has been bandaged, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.35_0: If she tells him, “Unwrap it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.36_0: When the other monk has sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.2_0: if she gets permission and then has it ruptured, split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.5_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.6_0: The tenth training rule is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.7_0: The sixth sub-chapter on monasteries is finished.
